section.title: Manage Content In Content Explorer
section.para: A web content is a key resource to make a site. Other resources make a site more dynamic and animated by using layout, color, font, and more.This section focuses on how to manage a web content in a specific site.

note.para: Only users who have the right to access Sites Management drive can do it.

section.title: Create a new web content
section.para: This function is used to add a new web content into a specific site.

step.para: Go to Sites Management drive, and then select a site that you want to add a web content.
Select the web content folder on the left.

note.para: In this step, you also can add a new web content into another folders (documents and media folder) of a site but you are recommended to select the web content folder because:

listitem.para: Manage web content of a site more easily.
You only may add a new web content in this folder so that you don't need to select a web content document in the list of document types. It makes adding a new web content more flexibly.

step.para:
Open a list of content templates by clicking the
[ Add Document ]
icon on the Action bar.
Select a template to present the web content by clicking one.

listitem.para: Picture on head layout web content:The site's content is presented in two spaces. One for inserting an image and one for editing the site's content. In which, the image is put at the head of a site.
Free layout web content:This template is a free layout.

step.para: Enter values in the fields of the Add New Document form.
Click Save or Save & Close to save the content or Close to quit the Add New Document form.

formalpara.title: Tabs in the Add New Document form

row.entry: The name of a web content that you want to add new
The title of a web content
The main content that you want to display when publishing this web content

formalpara.para: The Illustration tab: enables you to upload an illustration that makes the site's content more attractive

row.entry: The path to an image that you want to upload into a site. This image will be used like an illustration of that site.

You can give a short description about the web content because it will be displayed with the illustration image when the web content is listed. The main content will be shown when it is selected to be viewed.

formalpara.para: Do the following to upload an image:

step.para: Browse an image list on your local computer by clicking the Browse... button and then select a specific location.
Select an image in the list to upload.

formalpara.para: This tab includes two parts: CSS data and JS data:

row.entry: Contains CSS definition to present data in a web content. You can optionally enter CSS data into this field to specify the style.
Contains JS content to make the web content more dynamic when after publishing. You can optionally enter JS content in this field.

section.title: Edit a web content
section.para: This function is used to edit a web content in a specific drive of an existing site.

step.para: Go into the folder of a site which contains the web content that you want to edit.
Select the web content by double-clicking it on the left tree or on the right panel. The detailed information of web content will be viewed on the right panel.

Click the
[ Edit Document ]
icon on the action bar to show the form to edit the selected web content. This form is like the form to create a new document.
Change the current values in the fields of this form.
Complete editing the selected web content by clicking Save or Save & Close.

note.title: Auto-lock
note.para: When you click Edit Document, the web-content will be auto-locked for your editing. After finishing, the content is back to unlock status. You can manage Locks in the Administration portlet.

section.title: Delete a web content
section.para: This function is used to remove a web content from the web content folder in a specific site's drive.
To delete a web-content, do the following:

step.para: Right-click the name of the web content that you want to delete and then select Delete in the drop-down menu:
There will be a confirmation message. Click OK to accept the deletion, or Cancel to quit without deleting.

section.title: Publish a web content
section.para: This function helps you publish a web content that you have added to web content folder in Content Explorer.
See to know how to publish a web content.
After the content is published, all users who have the right to access that position can view the published web content as a page on the Navigation bar.
